intro: Mirabilis nyctaginea var. alpicola, commonly known as the alpine four o'clock, is a flowering plant native to high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that open in the evening. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine soils and thrives in cool, moist environments. Its leaves are succulent and fleshy, adapted to conserve water in harsh mountain conditions. The species is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its unique blooming pattern.
